title: 「和理非」機場低風險後續運動之超大型社會實驗

replies.msg:
話說自從機場禁制令實施後令機場抗爭風險增加，
但作為一年去台灣日本都去幾次去到買唔到樓嘅香港人，去旅行拖住個gip 應該有好大發揮空間

見唔少人gip上面都有好多貼紙之類嘅裝飾，又見之前有連登巴絲出去遊行派過好多 sticker，可唔可以兩樣野 crossover黎做？


Gip 上面五個對外嘅平面，可唔可以禁啱痴左5個對應五大訴求嘅貼紙上去？

唔痴唔大訴求都有大把文宣上去

示意圖如下：



Credit: 不知名嘅文宣作者

⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

社會實驗如下：

當一名香港人出使出入境自由從機場離境，同時行使言論自由拖住個有標語嘅gip，在場嘅機場保安、執達吏或黑警會點處理？

有冇違反禁制令：



1 (a) 經機場離境去旅行都唔係proper use?

(b)買哂機票經機場出境又唔係 protest? 個gip貼個貼紙都叫 demonstration? 呢啲叫 design 掛

(c) 經離境大堂離境去旅行，有機票有酒店booking 有行程，咁仲唔係 bona fide traveller?

(d) 大哥等飛機起飛先留係機場啫一定唔 loitering 啦

（e) 旅行拖住個gip好正常，咁都有得屈要禁止全世界拖gip?

(f) 去旅行要職員服務維持機場秩序 tim ar

（g) 我覺得唯一易屈市民係呢度， inciting ，引起，呢個term好 vague好含糊，有標語會唔會引起人嗌口號或者其他野？我唔知

⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

咁都怕咁點算？我都和理非我都好怕

唔用五大訴求禁香港禁明顯嘅文宣，用其他都得掛

對應返機場同去旅行多外國人

用外國名人嘅名句咁捉唔到啦：

“They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.”

Benjamin Franklin

“Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves.”

Abraham Lincoln

I prefer dangerous freedom over peaceful slavery.

Thomas Jefferson

Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.

Henry David Thoreau

Man is not free unless government is limited.

Ronald Reagan

Freedom is never given; it is won.

A. Philip Randolph


⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

實行上睇過 eprinX BannerXhop etc 都有得整貼紙，可能仲有其他舖頭，有冇人有良心舖頭介紹？

或者之前遊行整過貼紙派嘅巴絲有冇教學？


Btw睇過起貨要3-4個工作天，有冇現有抗爭貼紙持有人有貼紙可以出讓俾我，我今個星期去旅行想做實驗

⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

題外話：



禁制令第10段話反對禁制令令或受禁制令影響人士可以係禁制令發出5天內通知發出禁制令嘅律師樓等佢 serve個 copies俾 上述人士，呢個係咪可以加強禁制令使用成本方法？ 係嘅下次有新禁制令大家可以狂做！ 哂下佢郵寄錢 print 信錢人手成本都好！

⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

當年 Nazi Germany 係 Jewish 舖頭前面用符號標籤佢地，普通市民以為小事冇理到，最後營造左殘殺猶太人嘅環境，如果當時有人企出黎消除啲符號標籤會唔會改變到社會氣氛，改變到殘殺事件？

香港人，唔好睇少你做嘅每一件小事，每一次小事都可能感染到其他人繼續努力

寧化飛灰，不作浮塵
光復香港，時代革命

Push!

replies.msg:
Title: 「Peaceful, Rational, Non-violent」Less Risky Airport X Demonstration @ Ultra-Large Scale Social Experiment

Since the issuance of airport injunction order, protest at HK airport has become mote risky and dangerous. However, Hong Kongers, renowned for frequent travels, even at the cost of sacrificing property purchasing opportunities, could find a perfect cover with their travel companion: your gip.

It is often seeing gips with loads of decorative stickers and in previous demonstrations, lihkg Bros and Siss have also distributed stickers with rally slogan such as ‘Give me liberty or give me death’, ‘Please mind the Police thug’ etc. As such, combinations of rally slogan stickers and travel luggage naturally comes to my mind.

Could the 5 outward facing surface be sticked with the 5 rally demands?

Other than the 5 demands, there are tons of alternatives.

Time to showcase your creativity Hong Kongers:



The Chinese characters reads: Give me liberty or give me death (in a HK local humorous tune)

Credit to unidentified authors

I love you all real Hong Kongers

⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

The social experiment is as below:

A Hong Konger exercises his freedom to travel and to enter or leave the Region, and at the same time exercises his freedom of speech travelling with a gip full of rally slogans, how will AVSECO, bailiff and popo react?



Does it constitute a breach of injunction order?



1 (a)

Departing via HKIA for travel should be a proper use of HKIA

(b)

We are just travelling via HKIA. That’s not protest literally and technically. The stickers on luggages are design, not demonstration.

(c)

As a bona fide traveller, we do have our boarding pass, hotel bookings and itinerary for sure.

(d)

We are just waiting for our flights at departure hall

（e)

No worry, luggage is a must for travellers. They can’t catch all luggage carrying travellers.

(f)

We don’t obstruct staff of HKIA. We are their customers indeed.

（g)

Will a luggage with rally slogan be considered inciting? It’s arguable.

⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

What if rally slogan stickers are too aggressive for you?



There must be some grey areas and justice will find a way out



To cater for our target audience, usually foreigners at HKIA



There are lots of inspirational quotes

“They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.”

Benjamin Franklin

“Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves.”

Abraham Lincoln

I prefer dangerous freedom over peaceful slavery.

Thomas Jefferson

Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.

Henry David Thoreau

Man is not free unless government is limited.

Ronald Reagan

Freedom is never given; it is won.

A. Philip Randolph


⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯



Practically, eprinX BannerXhop etc offer stickers production services. Does anyone recognise any stores with conscience?



Any recommendations from lihkg Bros and Siss?

It’s checked that it takes 3-4 working days to complete stickers orders in the above mentioned stores. Could anyone lend me some rally slogan stickers for my experiment this week?

⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

Besides:


Para 10 of injunction order stated that we could request solicitor issuing the injunction order yo serve us the order by mail. It might at least raise their cost.

⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯⋯

In 30s of 20th century, Nazi Germany mobilised signalling of Jewish stores. People took it as a trivial matter at first and turned out it paved way for the holocaust.

If people stood out to halt the campaign, would the holocaust be at least hindered?

Hong Kongers, every deeds of you no matter how tiny might turn out be an inspiration for others, and even anyone in the furthest of this planet. Go Hong Kongers. Keep Fighting.

寧化飛灰，不作浮塵
光復香港，時代革命

I would rather be ashes than dust!

Liberate Hong Kong, revolution of our time!
